<h1><a name=v1-encoding-and-sanitization></a><a name="_Toc202716390"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span lang=EN-AU>V1 Encoding
and Sanitization</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'></span></h1>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><a
name=control-objective></a><a name="_Toc202716391"><span style='mso-bookmark:
control-objective'><span lang=EN-AU>Control Objective</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective'><span lang=EN-AU>This chapter addresses
the most common web application security weaknesses related to the unsafe
processing of untrusted data. Such weaknesses can result in various technical
vulnerabilities, where untrusted data is interpreted according to the syntax rules
of the relevant interpreter.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective'><span lang=EN-AU>For modern web
applications, it is always best to use safer APIs, such as parameterized
queries, auto-escaping, or templating frameworks. Otherwise, carefully
performed output encoding, escaping, or sanitization becomes critical to the
application’s security.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective'><span lang=EN-AU>Input validation serves
as a defense-in-depth mechanism to protect against unexpected or dangerous
content. However, since its primary purpose is to ensure that incoming content
matches functional and business expectations, requirements related to this can
be found in the “Validation and Business Logic” chapter.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><a
name=X505173db954d49db380f80f066b9be5df385537></a><a name="_Toc202716392"><span
style='mso-bookmark:X505173db954d49db380f80f066b9be5df385537'><span lang=EN-AU>V1.1
Encoding and Sanitization Architecture</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:
X505173db954d49db380f80f066b9be5df385537'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X505173db954d49db380f80f066b9be5df385537'><span lang=EN-AU>In
the sections below, syntax-specific or interpreter-specific requirements for
safely processing unsafe content to avoid security vulnerabilities are
provided. The requirements in this section cover the order in which this
processing should occur and where it should take place. They also aim to ensure
that whenever data is stored, it remains in its original state and is not
stored in an encoded or escaped form (e.g., HTML encoding), to prevent double
encoding issues.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><a
name=v1.2-injection-prevention></a><a name="_Toc202716393"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>V1.2
Injection Prevention</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>Output
encoding or escaping, performed close to or adjacent to a potentially dangerous
context, is critical to the security of any application. Typically, output
encoding and escaping are not persisted, but are instead used to render output
safe for immediate use in the appropriate interpreter. Attempting to perform
this too early may result in malformed content or render the encoding or
escaping ineffective.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>In many
cases, software libraries include safe or safer functions that perform this
automatically, although it is necessary to ensure that they are correct for the
current context.</span></span></span></p>

  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that output encoding for an HTTP response, HTML document, or XML document is
  relevant for the context required, such as encoding the relevant characters
  for HTML elements, HTML attributes, HTML comments, CSS, or HTTP header
  fields, to avoid changing the message or document structure.</span></span></span></p>

  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><b><span lang=EN-AU>1.2.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that when dynamically building URLs, untrusted data is encoded according to
  its context (e.g., URL encoding or base64url encoding for query or path
  parameters). Ensure that only safe URL protocols are permitted (e.g.,

 </tr>

 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:9'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><b><span lang=EN-AU>1.2.9</span></b></span></span></p>

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the application escapes special characters in regular expressions
  (typically using a backslash) to prevent them from being misinterpreted as
  metacharacters.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>

 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:10;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><b><span lang=EN-AU>1.2.10</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the application is protected against CSV and Formula Injection. The
  application must follow the escaping rules defined in RFC 4180 sections 2.6
  and 2.7 when exporting CSV content. Additionally, when exporting to CSV or
  other spreadsheet formats (such as XLS, XLSX, or ODF), special characters
  (including ‘=’, ‘+’, ‘-’, ‘@’, ‘’ (tab), and ‘\0’ (null character)) must be
  escaped with a single quote if they appear as the first character in a field
  value.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span></span>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'><span lang=EN-AU>Note: Using
parameterized queries or escaping SQL is not always sufficient. Query parts
such as table and column names (including “ORDER BY” column names) cannot be
escaped. Including escaped user-supplied data in these fields results in failed
queries or SQL injection.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.2-injection-prevention"'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><a
name=v1.3-sanitization></a><a name="_Toc202716394"><span style='mso-bookmark:
"v1\.3-sanitization"'><span lang=EN-AU>V1.3 Sanitization</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.3-sanitization"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.3-sanitization"'><span lang=EN-AU>The ideal protection
against using untrusted content in an unsafe context is to use context-specific
encoding or escaping, which maintains the same semantic meaning of the unsafe
content but renders it safe for use in that particular context, as discussed in
more detail in the previous section.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.3-sanitization"'><span lang=EN-AU>Where this is not
possible, sanitization becomes necessary, removing potentially dangerous
characters or content. In some cases, this may change the semantic meaning of
the input, but for security reasons, there may be no alternative.</span></span></span></p>

 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:7'>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.4-memory-string-and-unmanaged-code"'><span lang=EN-AU>The

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><a
name=v1.5-safe-deserialization></a><a name="_Toc202716396"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><span lang=EN-AU>V1.5 Safe
Deserialization</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><span lang=EN-AU>The
conversion of data from a stored or transmitted representation into actual
application objects (deserialization) has historically been the cause of
various code injection vulnerabilities. It is important to perform this process
carefully and safely to avoid these types of issues.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><span lang=EN-AU>In
particular, certain methods of deserialization have been identified by
programming language or framework documentation as insecure and cannot be made
safe with untrusted data. For each mechanism in use, careful due diligence
should be performed.</span></span></span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><b><span lang=EN-AU>1.5.1</span></b></span></span></p>

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the application configures XML parsers to use a restrictive
  configuration and that unsafe features such as resolving external entities
  are disabled to prevent XML eXternal Entity (XXE) attacks.</span></span></span></p>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><b><span lang=EN-AU>1.5.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that deserialization of untrusted data enforces safe input handling, such as
  using an allowlist of object types or restricting client-defined object
  types, to prevent deserialization attacks. Deserialization mechanisms that
  are explicitly defined as insecure must not be used with untrusted input.</span></span></span></p>

 </tr>

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><b><span lang=EN-AU>1.5.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v1-encoding-and-sanitization'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v1\.5-safe-deserialization"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that different parsers used in the application for the same data type (e.g.,
  JSON parsers, XML parsers, URL parsers), perform parsing in a consistent way
  and use the same character encoding mechanism to avoid issues such as JSON
  Interoperability vulnerabilities or different URI or file parsing behavior
  being exploited in Remote File Inclusion (RFI) or Server-side Request Forgery
  (SSRF) attacks.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><a
name=v2.2-input-validation></a><a name="_Toc202716401"><span style='mso-bookmark:
"v2\.2-input-validation"'><span lang=EN-AU>V2.2 Input Validation</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Effective input
validation controls enforce business or functional expectations around the type
of data the application expects to receive. This ensures good data quality and
reduces the attack surface. However, it does not remove or replace the need to use
correct encoding, parameterization, or sanitization when using the data in
another component or for presenting it for output.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'><span lang=EN-AU>In this context,
“input” could come from a wide variety of sources, including HTML form fields,
REST requests, URL parameters, HTTP header fields, cookies, files on disk,
databases, and external APIs.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'><span lang=EN-AU>A business logic
control might check that a particular input is a number less than 100. A
functional expectation might check that a number is below a certain threshold,
as that number controls how many times a particular loop will take place, and a
high number could lead to excessive processing and a potential denial of
service condition.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'><span lang=EN-AU>While schema
validation is not explicitly mandated, it may be the most effective mechanism
for full validation coverage of HTTP APIs or other interfaces that use JSON or
XML.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Please note the
following points on Schema Validation:</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo45'><span
style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><span style='mso-bookmark:
"v2\.2-input-validation"'><![if !supportLists]><span lang=EN-AU
style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>The “published version” of the
JSON Schema validation specification is considered production-ready, but not
strictly speaking “stable.” When using JSON Schema validation, ensure there are
no gaps with the guidance in the requirements below.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo45'><span
style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><span style='mso-bookmark:
"v2\.2-input-validation"'><![if !supportLists]><span lang=EN-AU
style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Any JSON Schema validation
libraries in use should also be monitored and updated if necessary once the
standard is formalized.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo45'><span

"v2\.2-input-validation"'><![if !supportLists]><span lang=EN-AU
style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;

used, and framework DTD evaluation should be disabled, to avoid issues with XXE
attacks against DTDs.</span></span></span></p>

  style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v2-validation-and-business-logic'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that
  input is validated to enforce business or functional expectations for that
  input. This should either use positive validation against an allow list of
  values, patterns, and ranges, or be based on comparing the input to an
  expected structure and logical limits according to predefined rules. For L1,
  this can focus on input which is used to make specific business or security
  decisions. For L2 and up, this should apply to all input.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>

  style='mso-bookmark:"v2\.2-input-validation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>

  lang=EN-AU>Verify that a Strict-Transport-Security header field is included

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.4.2</span></b></span></span></p>

  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that the Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin header field is a fixed value by the application,
  or if the Origin HTTP request header field value is used, it is validated
  against an allowlist of trusted origins. When ’Access-Control-Allow-Origin:
  *’ needs to be used, verify that the response does not include any sensitive
  information.</span></span></span></p>

  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>

  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
 </tr>

  lang=EN-AU>3.4.3</span></b></span></span></p>

  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that HTTP responses include a Content-Security-Policy
  response header field which defines directives to ensure the browser only
  loads and executes trusted content or resources, in order to limit execution
  of malicious JavaScript. As a minimum, a global policy must be used which
  includes the directives object-src ‘none’ and base-uri ‘none’ and defines
  either an allowlist or uses nonces or hashes. For an L3 application, a
  per-response policy with nonces or hashes must be defined.</span></span></span></p>

  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4'>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.4.4</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that all HTTP responses contain an ‘X-Content-Type-Options:
  nosniff’ header field. This instructs browsers not to use content sniffing
  and MIME type guessing for the given response, and to require the response’s
  Content-Type header field value to match the destination resource. For
  example, the response to a request for a style is only accepted if the
  response’s Content-Type is ‘text/css’. This also enables the use of the
  Cross-Origin Read Blocking (CORB) functionality by the browser.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:5'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.4.5</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that the application sets a referrer policy to prevent
  leakage of technically sensitive data to third-party services via the
  ‘Referer’ HTTP request header field. This can be done using the
  Referrer-Policy HTTP response header field or via HTML element attributes.
  Sensitive data could include path and query data in the URL, and for internal
  non-public applications also the hostname.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:6'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.4.6</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that the web application uses the frame-ancestors directive
  of the Content-Security-Policy header field for every HTTP response to ensure
  that it cannot be embedded by default and that embedding of specific
  resources is allowed only when necessary. Note that the X-Frame-Options
  header field, although supported by browsers, is obsolete and may not be
  relied upon.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:7'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.4.7</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that the Content-Security-Policy header field specifies a
  location to report violations.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:8;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.4.8</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that all HTTP responses that initiate a document rendering
  (such as responses with Content-Type text/html), include the
  Cross‑Origin‑Opener‑Policy header field with the same-origin directive or the
  same-origin-allow-popups directive as required. This prevents attacks that
  abuse shared access to Window objects, such as tabnabbing and frame counting.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span></span>
 </tr>
</table>

<span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.4-browser-security-mechanism-headers"'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><a
name=v3.5-browser-origin-separation></a><a name="_Toc202716411"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>V3.5
Browser Origin Separation</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>When
accepting a request to sensitive functionality on the server side, the
application needs to ensure the request is initiated by the application itself
or by a trusted party and has not been forged by an attacker.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Sensitive
functionality in this context could include accepting form posts for
authenticated and non-authenticated users (such as an authentication request),
state-changing operations, or resource-demanding functionality (such as data
export).</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>The key
protections here are browser security policies like Same Origin Policy for
JavaScript and also SameSite logic for cookies. Another common protection is
the CORS preflight mechanism. This mechanism will be critical for endpoints
designed to be called from a different origin, but it can also be a useful
request forgery prevention mechanism for endpoints which are not designed to be
called from a different origin.</span></span></span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-yfti-tbllook:32;mso-padding-alt:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
 <thead>
  <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
   <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
   <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
   style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>#</span></span></span></p>
   </td>
   <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
   <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
   <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
   style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Description</span></span></span></p>
   </td>
   <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
   <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
   <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
   style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Level</span></span></span></p>
   </td>
   <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  </tr>
 </thead>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.5.1</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that, if the application does not rely on the CORS preflight mechanism to
  prevent disallowed cross-origin requests to use sensitive functionality,
  these requests are validated to ensure they originate from the application
  itself. This may be done by using and validating anti-forgery tokens or
  requiring extra HTTP header fields that are not CORS-safelisted
  request-header fields. This is to defend against browser-based request
  forgery attacks, commonly known as cross-site request forgery (CSRF).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.5.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that, if the application relies on the CORS preflight mechanism to prevent
  disallowed cross-origin use of sensitive functionality, it is not possible to
  call the functionality with a request which does not trigger a CORS-preflight
  request. This may require checking the values of the ‘Origin’ and
  ‘Content-Type’ request header fields or using an extra header field that is
  not a CORS-safelisted header-field.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.5.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that HTTP requests to sensitive functionality use appropriate HTTP methods
  such as POST, PUT, PATCH, or DELETE, and not methods defined by the HTTP
  specification as “safe” such as HEAD, OPTIONS, or GET. Alternatively, strict
  validation of the Sec-Fetch-* request header fields can be used to ensure
  that the request did not originate from an inappropriate cross-origin call, a
  navigation request, or a resource load (such as an image source) where this
  is not expected.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.5.4</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that separate applications are hosted on different hostnames to leverage the
  restrictions provided by same-origin policy, including how documents or
  scripts loaded by one origin can interact with resources from another origin
  and hostname-based restrictions on cookies.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:5'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.5.5</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that messages received by the postMessage interface are discarded if the
  origin of the message is not trusted, or if the syntax of the message is
  invalid.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:6'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.5.6</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that JSONP functionality is not enabled anywhere across the application to
  avoid Cross-Site Script Inclusion (XSSI) attacks.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:7'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v3-web-frontend-security'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v3\.5-browser-origin-separation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>3.5.7</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><a

control-objective-3'><span lang=EN-AU>Control Objective</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-3'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-3'><span lang=EN-AU>Several
considerations apply specifically to applications that expose APIs for use by
web browsers or other consumers (commonly using JSON, XML, or GraphQL). This
chapter covers the relevant security configurations and mechanisms that should
be applied.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-3'><span lang=EN-AU>Note that
authentication, session management, and input validation concerns from other
chapters also apply to APIs, so this chapter cannot be taken out of context or
tested in isolation.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-3'></span>

  that every HTTP response with a message body contains a Content-Type header
  field that matches the actual content of the response, including the charset
  parameter to specify safe character encoding (e.g., UTF-8, ISO-8859-1)
  according to IANA Media Types, such as “text/”, “/+xml” and “/xml”.</span></span></span></p>

  <span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span style='mso-bookmark:

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.1-generic-web-service-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that only user-facing endpoints (intended for manual web-browser access)
  automatically redirect from HTTP to HTTPS, while other services or endpoints
  do not implement transparent redirects. This is to avoid a situation where a
  client is erroneously sending unencrypted HTTP requests, but since the
  requests are being automatically redirected to HTTPS, the leakage of
  sensitive data goes undiscovered.</span></span></span></p>

  "v4\.1-generic-web-service-security"'></span></span>

  <span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v4\.1-generic-web-service-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.1-generic-web-service-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that any HTTP header field used by the application and set by an intermediary
  layer, such as a load balancer, a web proxy, or a backend-for-frontend

  X-Real-IP, X-Forwarded-*, or X-User-ID.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><a
name=v4.2-http-message-structure-validation></a><a name="_Toc202716418"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'><span
lang=EN-AU>V4.2 HTTP Message Structure Validation</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'><span
lang=EN-AU>This section explains how the structure and header fields of an HTTP
message should be validated to prevent attacks such as request smuggling,
response splitting, header injection, and denial of service via overly long
HTTP messages.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'><span
lang=EN-AU>These requirements are relevant for general HTTP message processing
and generation, but are especially important when converting HTTP messages
between different HTTP versions.</span></span></span></p>

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>4.2.1</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that all application components (including load balancers,
  firewalls, and application servers) determine boundaries of incoming HTTP
  messages using the appropriate mechanism for the HTTP version to prevent HTTP
  request smuggling. In HTTP/1.x, if a Transfer-Encoding header field is
  present, the Content-Length header must be ignored per RFC 2616. When using
  HTTP/2 or HTTP/3, if a Content-Length header field is present, the receiver
  must ensure that it is consistent with the length of the DATA frames.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'></span></span>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span

  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span

  lang=EN-AU>4.2.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that when generating HTTP messages, the Content-Length
  header field does not conflict with the length of the content as determined
  by the framing of the HTTP protocol, in order to prevent request smuggling
  attacks.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v4-api-and-web-service'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  "v4\.2-http-message-structure-validation"'></span></span>

channel.</span></span></span></p>

<h1><a name=v6-authentication></a><a name="_Toc202716429"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span lang=EN-AU>V6 Authentication</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'></span></h1>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><a name=control-objective-5></a><a
name="_Toc202716430"><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'><span
lang=EN-AU>Control Objective</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'><span lang=EN-AU>Authentication is the
process of establishing or confirming the authenticity of an individual or
device. It involves verifying claims made by a person or about a device,
ensuring resistance to impersonation, and preventing the recovery or
interception of passwords.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/"><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'><span lang=EN-AU>NIST SP 800-63</span></span></span><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'><span
lang=EN-AU> is a modern, evidence-based standard that is valuable for
organizations worldwide, but is particularly relevant to US agencies and those
interacting with US agencies.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'><span lang=EN-AU>While many of the
requirements in this chapter are based on the second section of the standard
(known as NIST SP 800-63B “Digital Identity Guidelines - Authentication and
Lifecycle Management”), the chapter focuses on common threats and frequently
exploited authentication weaknesses. It does not attempt to comprehensively
cover every point in the standard. For cases where full NIST SP 800-63
compliance is necessary, please refer to NIST SP 800-63.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'><span lang=EN-AU>Additionally, NIST SP
800-63 terminology may sometimes differ, and this chapter often uses more
commonly understood terminology to improve clarity.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'><span lang=EN-AU>A common feature of
more advanced applications is the ability to adapt authentication stages
required based on various risk factors. This feature is covered in the
“Authorization” chapter, since these mechanisms also need to be considered for
authorization decisions.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-5'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><a
name=v6.2-password-security></a><a name="_Toc202716432"><span style='mso-bookmark:
"v6\.2-password-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>V6.2 Password Security</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>Passwords,
called “Memorized Secrets” by NIST SP 800-63, include passwords, passphrases,
PINs, unlock patterns, and picking the correct kitten or another image element.
They are generally considered “something you know” and are often used as a
single-factor authentication mechanism.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>As such, this
section contains requirements for making sure that passwords are created and
handled securely. Most of the requirements are L1 as they are most important at
that level. From L2 onwards, multi-factor authentication mechanisms are
required, where passwords may be one of those factors.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>The
requirements in this section mostly relate to </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html#memsecretver"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>§ 5.1.1.2</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU> of </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html"><span style='mso-bookmark:
v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>NIST’s Guidance</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.2-password-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><a
name=v6.3-general-authentication-security></a><a name="_Toc202716433"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>V6.3
General Authentication Security</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:
"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>This
section contains general requirements for the security of authentication
mechanisms as well as setting out the different expectations for levels. L2
applications must force the use of multi-factor authentication (MFA). L3
applications must use hardware-based authentication, performed in an attested
and trusted execution environment (TEE). This could include device-bound
passkeys, eIDAS Level of Assurance (LoA) High enforced authenticators,
authenticators with NIST Authenticator Assurance Level 3 (AAL3) assurance, or
an equivalent mechanism.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>While
this is a relatively aggressive stance on MFA, it is critical to raise the bar
around this to protect users, and any attempt to relax these requirements
should be accompanied by a clear plan on how the risks around authentication
will be mitigated, taking into account NIST’s guidance and research on the
topic.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>Note
that at the time of release, NIST SP 800-63 considers email as </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-FAQ/#q-b11"><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>not
acceptable</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU> as an authentication mechanism (</span></span></span><a
href="https://web.archive.org/web/20250330115328/https:/pages.nist.gov/800-63-FAQ/#q-b11"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>archived copy</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>).</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span lang=EN-AU>The
requirements in this section relate to a variety of sections of </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html"><span style='mso-bookmark:
v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>NIST’s Guidance</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>, including: </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html#421-permitted-authenticator-types"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>§ 4.2.1</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>, </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html#431-permitted-authenticator-types"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>§ 4.3.1</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>, </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html#522-rate-limiting-throttling"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>§ 5.2.2</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>, and </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html#-612-post-enrollment-binding"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>§ 6.1.2</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
lang=EN-AU>.</span></span></span></p>

 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.3.1</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that controls to prevent attacks such as credential
  stuffing and password brute force are implemented according to the
  application’s security documentation.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.3.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that default user accounts (e.g., “root”, “admin”, or “sa”)
  are not present in the application or are disabled.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.3.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that either a multi-factor authentication mechanism or a
  combination of single-factor authentication mechanisms, must be used in order
  to access the application. For L3, one of the factors must be a
  hardware-based authentication mechanism which provides compromise and
  impersonation resistance against phishing attacks while verifying the intent
  to authenticate by requiring a user-initiated action (such as a button press
  on a FIDO hardware key or a mobile phone). Relaxing any of the considerations
  in this requirement requires a fully documented rationale and a comprehensive
  set of mitigating controls.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.3.4</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that, if the application includes multiple authentication
  pathways, there are no undocumented pathways and that security controls and
  authentication strength are enforced consistently.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:5'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.3.5</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that users are notified of suspicious authentication
  attempts (successful or unsuccessful). This may include authentication
  attempts from an unusual location or client, partially successful
  authentication (only one of multiple factors), an authentication attempt
  after a long period of inactivity or a successful authentication after
  several unsuccessful attempts.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:6'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.3.6</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that email is not used as either a single-factor or
  multi-factor authentication mechanism.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:7'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.3.7</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that users are notified after updates to authentication
  details, such as credential resets or modification of the username or email
  address.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:8;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.3.8</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that valid users cannot be deduced from failed
  authentication challenges, such as by basing on error messages, HTTP response
  codes, or different response times. Registration and forgot password
  functionality must also have this protection.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span></span>
 </tr>
</table>

<span style='mso-bookmark:"v6\.3-general-authentication-security"'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><a
name=X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32></a><a name="_Toc202716434"><span

Authentication Factor Lifecycle and Recovery</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span

factors may include passwords, soft tokens, hardware tokens, and biometric
devices. Securely handling the lifecycle of these mechanisms is critical to the
security of an application, and this section includes requirements related to
this.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span lang=EN-AU>The

lang=EN-AU>§ 5.1.1.2</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
lang=EN-AU> or </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html#replacement"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
lang=EN-AU>§ 6.1.2.3</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
lang=EN-AU> of </span></span></span><a
href="https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html"><span style='mso-bookmark:
v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
lang=EN-AU>NIST’s Guidance</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
lang=EN-AU>.</span></span></span></p>

  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><b><span

  lang=EN-AU>Verify that system generated initial passwords or activation codes
  are securely randomly generated, follow the existing password policy, and
  expire after a short period of time or after they are initially used. These
  initial secrets must not be permitted to become the long term password.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span>

  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span

  style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that password hints or knowledge-based authentication
  (so-called “secret questions”) are not present.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span>

  </td>

 </tr>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>6.4.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that a secure process for resetting a forgotten password is
  implemented, that does not bypass any enabled multi-factor authentication
  mechanisms.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span>

  style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that if a multi-factor authentication factor is lost,
  evidence of identity proofing is performed at the same level as during
  enrollment.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span>

  lang=EN-AU>6.4.5</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that renewal instructions for authentication mechanisms
  which expire are sent with enough time to be carried out before the old
  authentication mechanism expires, configuring automated reminders if
  necessary.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span

  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>

  <span style='mso-bookmark:v6-authentication'><span style='mso-bookmark:X5cd9cd9128b74f7a93e4ba4aac6a164cc6b4d32'></span></span>
 </tr>
