  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.3.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the resource server enforces authorization decisions based on claims
  from the access token that define delegated authorization. If claims such as
  ‘sub’, ‘scope’, and ‘authorization_details’ are present, they must be part of
  the decision.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.3.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that if an access control decision requires identifying a unique user from an
  access token (JWT or related token introspection response), the resource
  server identifies the user from claims that cannot be reassigned to other
  users. Typically, it means using a combination of ‘iss’ and ‘sub’ claims.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.3.4</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that, if the resource server requires specific authentication strength,
  methods, or recentness, it verifies that the presented access token satisfies
  these constraints. For example, if present, using the OIDC ‘acr’, ‘amr’ and
  ‘auth_time’ claims respectively.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:5;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.3.5</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the resource server prevents the use of stolen access tokens or replay
  of access tokens (from unauthorized parties) by requiring sender-constrained
  access tokens, either Mutual TLS for OAuth 2 or OAuth 2 Demonstration of
  Proof of Possession (DPoP).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
</table>

<span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.3-oauth-resource-server"'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><a
name=v10.4-oauth-authorization-server></a><a name="_Toc202716466"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>V10.4
OAuth Authorization Server</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>These
requirements detail the responsibilities for OAuth authorization servers,
including OpenID Providers.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>For
client authentication, the ‘self_signed_tls_client_auth’ method is allowed with
the prerequisites required by </span></span></span><a
href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8705#name-self-signed-certificate-mut"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
lang=EN-AU>section 2.2</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
lang=EN-AU> of </span></span></span><a
href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8705"><span style='mso-bookmark:
v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
lang=EN-AU>RFC 8705</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
lang=EN-AU>.</span></span></span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-yfti-tbllook:32;mso-padding-alt:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
 <thead>
  <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
   <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
   <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
   style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
   lang=EN-AU>#</span></span></span></p>
   </td>
   <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
   <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
   <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
   style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Description</span></span></span></p>
   </td>
   <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
   <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
   <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
   style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
   lang=EN-AU>Level</span></span></span></p>
   </td>
   <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  </tr>
 </thead>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.1</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the authorization server validates redirect URIs based on a
  client-specific allowlist of pre-registered URIs using exact string
  comparison.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that, if the authorization server returns the authorization code in the
  authorization response, it can be used only once for a token request. For the
  second valid request with an authorization code that has already been used to
  issue an access token, the authorization server must reject a token request
  and revoke any issued tokens related to the authorization code.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the authorization code is short-lived. The maximum lifetime can be up to
  10 minutes for L1 and L2 applications and up to 1 minute for L3 applications.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.4</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that for a given client, the authorization server only allows the usage of
  grants that this client needs to use. Note that the grants ‘token’ (Implicit
  flow) and ‘password’ (Resource Owner Password Credentials flow) must no
  longer be used.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:5'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.5</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the authorization server mitigates refresh token replay attacks for
  public clients, preferably using sender-constrained refresh tokens, i.e.,
  Demonstrating Proof of Possession (DPoP) or Certificate-Bound Access Tokens
  using mutual TLS (mTLS). For L1 and L2 applications, refresh token rotation
  may be used. If refresh token rotation is used, the authorization server must
  invalidate the refresh token after usage, and revoke all refresh tokens for
  that authorization if an already used and invalidated refresh token is
  provided.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:6'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.6</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that, if the code grant is used, the authorization server mitigates
  authorization code interception attacks by requiring proof key for code
  exchange (PKCE). For authorization requests, the authorization server must
  require a valid ‘code_challenge’ value and must not accept a
  ‘code_challenge_method’ value of ‘plain’. For a token request, it must
  require validation of the ‘code_verifier’ parameter.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:7'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.7</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that if the authorization server supports unauthenticated dynamic client
  registration, it mitigates the risk of malicious client applications. It must
  validate client metadata such as any registered URIs, ensure the user’s
  consent, and warn the user before processing an authorization request with an
  untrusted client application.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:8'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.8</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that refresh tokens have an absolute expiration, including if sliding refresh
  token expiration is applied.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:9'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.9</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that refresh tokens and reference access tokens can be revoked by an
  authorized user using the authorization server user interface, to mitigate
  the risk of malicious clients or stolen tokens.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:10'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.10</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that confidential client is authenticated for client-to-authorized server
  backchannel requests such as token requests, pushed authorization requests
  (PAR), and token revocation requests.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:11'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.11</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the authorization server configuration only assigns the required scopes
  to the OAuth client.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:12'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.12</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that for a given client, the authorization server only allows the
  ‘response_mode’ value that this client needs to use. For example, by having
  the authorization server validate this value against the expected values or
  by using pushed authorization request (PAR) or JWT-secured Authorization
  Request (JAR).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:13'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.13</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that grant type ‘code’ is always used together with pushed authorization
  requests (PAR).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:14'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.14</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the authorization server issues only sender-constrained
  (Proof-of-Possession) access tokens, either with certificate-bound access
  tokens using mutual TLS (mTLS) or DPoP-bound access tokens (Demonstration of
  Proof of Possession).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:15'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.15</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that, for a server-side client (which is not executed on the end-user
  device), the authorization server ensures that the ‘authorization_details’
  parameter value is from the client backend and that the user has not tampered
  with it. For example, by requiring the usage of pushed authorization request
  (PAR) or JWT-secured Authorization Request (JAR).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:16;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.4.16</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the client is confidential and the authorization server requires the use
  of strong client authentication methods (based on public-key cryptography and
  resistant to replay attacks), such as mutual TLS (‘tls_client_auth’,
  ‘self_signed_tls_client_auth’) or private key JWT (‘private_key_jwt’).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>3</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span></span>
 </tr>
</table>

<span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.4-oauth-authorization-server"'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><a name=v10.5-oidc-client></a><a
name="_Toc202716467"><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span
lang=EN-AU>V10.5 OIDC Client</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span lang=EN-AU>As the OIDC relying
party acts as an OAuth client, the requirements from the section “OAuth Client”
apply as well.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span lang=EN-AU>Note that the
“Authentication with an Identity Provider” section in the “Authentication”
chapter also contains relevant general requirements.</span></span></span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-yfti-tbllook:32;mso-padding-alt:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
 <thead>
  <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
   <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>

   lang=EN-AU>Level</span></span></span></p>
   </td>
   <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:
   "v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
  </tr>
 </thead>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.5.1</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that the
  client (as the relying party) mitigates ID Token replay attacks. For example,
  by ensuring that the ‘nonce’ claim in the ID Token matches the ‘nonce’ value
  sent in the authentication request to the OpenID Provider (in OAuth2 refereed
  to as the authorization request sent to the authorization server).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.5.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that the
  client uniquely identifies the user from ID Token claims, usually the ‘sub’
  claim, which cannot be reassigned to other users (for the scope of an
  identity provider).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.5.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that the
  client rejects attempts by a malicious authorization server to impersonate
  another authorization server through authorization server metadata. The
  client must reject authorization server metadata if the issuer URL in the
  authorization server metadata does not exactly match the pre-configured
  issuer URL expected by the client.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>10.5.4</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v10\.5-oidc-client"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v10-oauth-and-oidc'><span

  ‘logout+jwt’, contains the ‘event’ claim with the correct member name, and

  short expiration (e.g., 2 minutes).</span></span></span></p>

<h1><a name=v11-cryptography></a><a name="_Toc202716471"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span lang=EN-AU>V11 Cryptography</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'></span></h1>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><a name=control-objective-10></a><a
name="_Toc202716472"><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><span
lang=EN-AU>Control Objective</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><span lang=EN-AU>The objective of
this chapter is to define best practices for the general use of cryptography,
as well as to instill a fundamental understanding of cryptographic principles
and inspire a shift toward more resilient and modern approaches. It encourages
the following:</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo66'><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Implementing robust
cryptographic systems that fail securely, adapt to evolving threats, and are
future-proof.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo66'><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Utilizing cryptographic
mechanisms that are both secure and aligned with industry best practices.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo66'><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Maintaining a secure
cryptographic key management system with appropriate access controls and
auditing.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo66'><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Regularly evaluating the
cryptographic landscape to assess new risks and adapt algorithms accordingly.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo66'><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Discovering and managing
cryptographic use cases throughout the application’s lifecycle to ensure that
all cryptographic assets are accounted for and secured.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><span lang=EN-AU>In addition to
outlining general principles and best practices, this document also provides
more in-depth technical information about the requirements in Appendix C -
Cryptography Standards. This includes algorithms and modes that are considered
“approved” for the purposes of the requirements in this chapter.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'><span lang=EN-AU>Requirements that
use cryptography to solve a separate problem, such as secrets management or
communications security, will be in different parts of the standard.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-10'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><a
name=X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a></a><a name="_Toc202716473"><span
style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><span lang=EN-AU>V11.1
Cryptographic Inventory and Documentation</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><span lang=EN-AU>Applications
need to be designed with strong cryptographic architecture to protect data
assets according to their classification. Encrypting everything is wasteful;
not encrypting anything is legally negligent. A balance must be struck, usually
during architectural or high-level design, design sprints, or architectural
spikes. Designing cryptography “on the fly” or retrofitting it will inevitably
cost much more to implement securely than simply building it in from the start.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><span lang=EN-AU>It
is important to ensure that all cryptographic assets are regularly discovered,
inventoried, and assessed. Please see the appendix for more information on how
this can be done.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><span lang=EN-AU>The
need to future-proof cryptographic systems against the eventual rise of quantum
computing is also critical. Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) refers to
cryptographic algorithms designed to remain secure against attacks by quantum
computers, which are expected to break widely used algorithms such as RSA and
elliptic curve cryptography (ECC).</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><span lang=EN-AU>Please
see the appendix for current guidance on vetted PQC primitives and standards.</span></span></span></p>

  lang=EN-AU>11.1.1</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that there is a documented policy for management of
  cryptographic keys and a cryptographic key lifecycle that follows a key
  management standard such as NIST SP 800-57. This should include ensuring that
  keys are not overshared (for example, with more than two entities for shared
  secrets and more than one entity for private keys).</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'></span></span>

  lang=EN-AU>11.1.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'></span></span>

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that a cryptographic inventory is performed, maintained,
  regularly updated, and includes all cryptographic keys, algorithms, and
  certificates used by the application. It must also document where keys can
  and cannot be used in the system, and the types of data that can and cannot
  be protected using the keys.</span></span></span></p>

  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3'>

  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><b><span

  style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that cryptographic discovery mechanisms are employed to
  identify all instances of cryptography in the system, including encryption,
  hashing, and signing operations.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:X1d91bb3fdc8e50e88d64c88d6db1cf296edbf6a'></span></span>

  lang=EN-AU>Verify that a cryptographic inventory is maintained. This must
  include a documented plan that outlines the migration path to new
  cryptographic standards, such as post-quantum cryptography, in order to react
  to future threats.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><a
name=v11.2-secure-cryptography-implementation></a><a name="_Toc202716474"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><span
lang=EN-AU>V11.2 Secure Cryptography Implementation</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><span
lang=EN-AU>This section defines the requirements for the selection,
implementation, and ongoing management of core cryptographic algorithms for an
application. The objective is to ensure that only robust, industry-accepted
cryptographic primitives are deployed, in alignment with current standards
(e.g., NIST, ISO/IEC) and best practices. Organizations must ensure that each
cryptographic component is selected based on peer-reviewed evidence and
practical security testing.</span></span></span></p>

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that industry-validated implementations (including

 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>11.2.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that the application is designed with crypto agility such
  that random number, authenticated encryption, MAC, or hashing algorithms, key
  lengths, rounds, ciphers and modes can be reconfigured, upgraded, or swapped
  at any time, to protect against cryptographic breaks. Similarly, it must also
  be possible to replace keys and passwords and re-encrypt data. This will
  allow for seamless upgrades to post-quantum cryptography (PQC), once
  high-assurance implementations of approved PQC schemes or standards are widely
  available.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>11.2.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that all cryptographic primitives utilize a minimum of
  128-bits of security based on the algorithm, key size, and configuration. For
  example, a 256-bit ECC key provides roughly 128 bits of security where RSA
  requires a 3072-bit key to achieve 128 bits of security.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span>

  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:4'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>11.2.4</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that all cryptographic operations are constant-time, with
  no ‘short-circuit’ operations in comparisons, calculations, or returns, to
  avoid leaking information.</span></span></span></p>

  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.2-secure-cryptography-implementation"'></span></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><a
name=v11.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions></a><a name="_Toc202716476"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
lang=EN-AU>V11.4 Hashing and Hash-based Functions</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
lang=EN-AU>Cryptographic hashes are used in a wide variety of cryptographic
protocols, such as digital signatures, HMAC, key derivation functions (KDF),
random bit generation, and password storage. The security of the cryptographic
system is only as strong as the underlying hash functions used. This section
outlines the requirements for using secure hash functions in cryptographic
operations.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
lang=EN-AU>For password storage, as well as the cryptography appendix, the </span></span></span><a
href="https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Password_Storage_Cheat_Sheet.html#password-hashing-algorithms"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
lang=EN-AU>OWASP Password Storage Cheat Sheet</span></span></span><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
lang=EN-AU> will also provide useful context and guidance.</span></span></span></p>

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><b><span

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that only approved hash functions are used for general
  cryptographic use cases, including digital signatures, HMAC, KDF, and random
  bit generation. Disallowed hash functions, such as MD5, must not be used for
  any cryptographic purpose.</span></span></span></p>

  lang=EN-AU>1</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>11.4.2</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that passwords are stored using an approved,
  computationally intensive, key derivation function (also known as a “password
  hashing function”), with parameter settings configured based on current
  guidance. The settings should balance security and performance to make
  brute-force attacks sufficiently challenging for the required level of
  security.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span>
 </tr>

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>11.4.3</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that hash functions used in digital signatures, as part of
  data authentication or data integrity are collision resistant and have
  appropriate bit-lengths. If collision resistance is required, the output
  length must be at least 256 bits. If only resistance to second pre-image
  attacks is required, the output length must be at least 128 bits.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span>

  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>

 </tr>

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><b><span
  lang=EN-AU>11.4.4</span></b></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.4-hashing-and-hash-based-functions"'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that the application uses approved key derivation functions
  with key stretching parameters when deriving secret keys from passwords. The
  parameters in use must balance security and performance to prevent
  brute-force attacks from compromising the resulting cryptographic key.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><a name=v11.5-random-values></a><a

lang=EN-AU>V11.5 Random Values</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.5-random-values"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v11-cryptography'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v11\.5-random-values"'><span lang=EN-AU>Cryptographically
secure Pseudo-random Number Generation (CSPRNG) is incredibly difficult to get
right. Generally, good sources of entropy within a system will be quickly
depleted if over-used, but sources with less randomness can lead to predictable
keys and secrets.</span></span></span></p>

  random numbers and strings which are intended to be non-guessable must be

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v12-secure-communication'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v12\.1-general-tls-security-guidance"'><span lang=EN-AU>This

basis.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v12-secure-communication'><span

and the use of separate TLS certificates in different environments should be
employed if possible.</span></span></span></p>

  lang=EN-AU>Verify that services communicating internally within a system
  (intra-service communications) use strong authentication to ensure that each
  endpoint is verified. Strong authentication methods, such as TLS client
  authentication, must be employed to ensure identity, using public-key
  infrastructure and mechanisms that are resistant to replay attacks. For
  microservice architectures, consider using a service mesh to simplify
  certificate management and enhance security.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><a name=control-objective-12></a><a

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-12'><span lang=EN-AU>The application’s

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-12'><span lang=EN-AU>This chapter

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-12'><span lang=EN-AU>Topics covered
include preventing data leakage, securely managing communication between
components, and protecting secrets.</span></span></span></p>

communicates with internal and external services, as well as techniques to
prevent loss of availability due to service inaccessibility. It also addresses
documentation related to secrets.</span></span></span></p>

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.1-configuration-documentation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that for each service the application uses, the documentation defines the

  how the application behaves when that limit is reached, including any

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.1-configuration-documentation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that the application documentation defines resource‑management strategies for
  every external system or service it uses (e.g., databases, file handles,
  threads, HTTP connections). This should include resource‑release procedures,
  timeout settings, failure handling, and where retry logic is implemented,
  specifying retry limits, delays, and back‑off algorithms. For synchronous

  disable retries or strictly limit retries to prevent cascading delays and
  resource exhaustion.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><a
name=v13.3-secret-management></a><a name="_Toc202716491"><span

Management</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.3-secret-management"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.3-secret-management"'><span lang=EN-AU>Secret
management is an essential configuration task to ensure the protection of data
used in the application. Specific requirements for cryptography can be found in
the “Cryptography” chapter, but this section focuses on the management and
handling aspects of secrets.</span></span></span></p>

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.3-secret-management"'><b><span

  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.3-secret-management"'></span></span>
  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.3-secret-management"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that
  a secrets management solution, such as a key vault, is used to securely
  create, store, control access to, and destroy backend secrets. These could
  include passwords, key material, integrations with databases and third-party
  systems, keys and seeds for time-based tokens, other internal secrets, and
  API keys. Secrets must not be included in application source code or included
  in build artifacts. For an L3 application, this must involve a
  hardware-backed solution such as an HSM.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.3-secret-management"'></span></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><a
name=v13.4-unintended-information-leakage></a><a name="_Toc202716492"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.4-unintended-information-leakage"'><span lang=EN-AU>V13.4
Unintended Information Leakage</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.4-unintended-information-leakage"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.4-unintended-information-leakage"'><span lang=EN-AU>Production
configurations should be hardened to avoid disclosing unnecessary data. Many of
these issues are rarely rated as significant risks but are often chained with
other vulnerabilities. If these issues are not present by default, it raises
the bar for attacking an application.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v13-configuration'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v13\.4-unintended-information-leakage"'><span lang=EN-AU>For
example, hiding the version of server-side components does not eliminate the
need to patch all components, and disabling folder listing does not remove the
need to use authorization controls or keep files away from the public folder,
but it raises the bar.</span></span></span></p>

<h1><a name=v14-data-protection></a><a name="_Toc202716494"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'><span lang=EN-AU>V14 Data Protection</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'></span></h1>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'><a
name=control-objective-13></a><a name="_Toc202716495"><span style='mso-bookmark:
control-objective-13'><span lang=EN-AU>Control Objective</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-13'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-13'><span lang=EN-AU>Applications cannot
account for all usage patterns and user behaviors, and should therefore
implement controls to limit unauthorized access to sensitive data on client
devices.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-13'><span lang=EN-AU>This chapter
includes requirements related to defining what data needs to be protected, how
it should be protected, and specific mechanisms to implement or pitfalls to
avoid.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-13'><span lang=EN-AU>Another
consideration for data protection is bulk extraction, modification, or
excessive usage. Each system’s requirements are likely to be very different, so
determining what is “abnormal” must consider the threat model and business
risk. From an ASVS perspective, detecting these issues is handled in the
“Security Logging and Error Handling” chapter, and setting limits is handled in
the “Validation and Business Logic” chapter.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-13'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'><a
name=v14.1-data-protection-documentation></a><a name="_Toc202716496"><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v14\.1-data-protection-documentation"'><span lang=EN-AU>V14.1
Data Protection Documentation</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:"v14\.1-data-protection-documentation"'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v14\.1-data-protection-documentation"'><span lang=EN-AU>A
key prerequisite for being able to protect data is to categorize what data
should be considered sensitive. There are likely to be several different levels
of sensitivity, and for each level, the controls required to protect data at
that level will be different.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v14-data-protection'><span
style='mso-bookmark:"v14\.1-data-protection-documentation"'><span lang=EN-AU>There
are various privacy regulations and laws that affect how applications must
approach the storage, use, and transmission of sensitive personal information.
This section no longer tries to duplicate these types of data protection or
privacy legislation, but rather focuses on key technical considerations for
protecting sensitive data. Please consult local laws and regulations, and
consult a qualified privacy specialist or lawyer as required.</span></span></span></p>

  style='mso-bookmark:"v14\.1-data-protection-documentation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that all sensitive data created and processed by the application has been
  identified and classified into protection levels. This includes data that is
  only encoded and therefore easily decoded, such as Base64 strings or the
  plaintext payload inside a JWT. Protection levels need to take into account
  any data protection and privacy regulations and standards which the

  style='mso-bookmark:"v14\.1-data-protection-documentation"'><span lang=EN-AU>Verify
  that all sensitive data protection levels have a documented set of protection
  requirements. This must include (but not be limited to) requirements related

  that caching mechanisms are configured to only cache responses which have the
  expected content type for that resource and do not contain sensitive, dynamic

  non-existent file is accessed rather than returning a different, valid file.

<h1><a name=v15-secure-coding-and-architecture></a><a name="_Toc202716500"><span
style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span lang=EN-AU>V15
Secure Coding and Architecture</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'></span></h1>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><a
name=control-objective-14></a><a name="_Toc202716501"><span style='mso-bookmark:
control-objective-14'><span lang=EN-AU>Control Objective</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-14'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-14'><span lang=EN-AU>Many ASVS
requirements either relate to a particular area of security, such as
authentication or authorization, or pertain to a particular type of application
functionality, such as logging or file handling.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-14'><span lang=EN-AU>This chapter
provides general security requirements to consider when designing and
developing applications. These requirements focus not only on clean
architecture and code quality but also on specific architecture and coding
practices necessary for application security.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:control-objective-14'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><a
name=Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71></a><a name="_Toc202716502"><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71'><span lang=EN-AU>V15.1
Secure Coding and Architecture Documentation</span></span></a><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71'><span lang=EN-AU>Many
requirements for establishing a secure and defensible architecture depend on
clear documentation of decisions made regarding the implementation of specific
security controls and the components used within the application.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71'><span lang=EN-AU>This
section outlines the documentation requirements, including identifying
components considered to contain “dangerous functionality” or to be “risky
components.”</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71'><span lang=EN-AU>A
component with “dangerous functionality” may be an internally developed or
third-party component that performs operations such as deserialization of
untrusted data, raw file or binary data parsing, dynamic code execution, or
direct memory manipulation. Vulnerabilities in these types of operations pose a
high risk of compromising the application and potentially exposing its
underlying infrastructure.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71'><span lang=EN-AU>A
“risky component” is a 3rd party library (i.e., not internally developed) with
missing or poorly implemented security controls around its development
processes or functionality. Examples include components that are poorly
maintained, unsupported, at the end-of-life stage, or have a history of
significant vulnerabilities.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71'><span lang=EN-AU>This
section also emphasizes the importance of defining appropriate timeframes for
addressing vulnerabilities in third-party components.</span></span></span></p>

  <td valign=top style='padding:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:Xf74928e74254e01a2309ce59924f5c082cffb71'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that the application documentation identifies functionality
  which is time-consuming or resource-demanding. This must include how to
  prevent a loss of availability due to overusing this functionality and how to
  avoid a situation where building a response takes longer than the consumer’s
  timeout. Potential defenses may include asynchronous processing, using
  queues, and limiting parallel processes per user and per application.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><a
name=Xb57b3c253c4041fc8c2d6c1614d044721eaa4b8></a><a name="_Toc202716503"><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xb57b3c253c4041fc8c2d6c1614d044721eaa4b8'><span lang=EN-AU>V15.2
Security Architecture and Dependencies</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:
Xb57b3c253c4041fc8c2d6c1614d044721eaa4b8'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xb57b3c253c4041fc8c2d6c1614d044721eaa4b8'><span lang=EN-AU>This
section includes requirements for handling risky, outdated, or insecure
dependencies and components through dependency management.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
style='mso-bookmark:Xb57b3c253c4041fc8c2d6c1614d044721eaa4b8'><span lang=EN-AU>It
also includes using architectural-level techniques such as sandboxing,
encapsulation, containerization, and network isolation to reduce the impact of
using “dangerous operations” or “risky components” (as defined in the previous
section) and prevent loss of availability due to overusing resource-demanding
functionality.</span></span></span></p>

  <span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span

  style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span

  style='mso-bookmark:Xb57b3c253c4041fc8c2d6c1614d044721eaa4b8'><span
  lang=EN-AU>Verify that the production environment only includes functionality
  that is required for the application to function, and does not expose
  extraneous functionality such as test code, sample snippets, and development
  functionality.</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span

  style='mso-bookmark:Xb57b3c253c4041fc8c2d6c1614d044721eaa4b8'><span
  lang=EN-AU>2</span></span></span></p>
  </td>
  <span style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:v15-secure-coding-and-architecture'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:Xb57b3c253c4041fc8c2d6c1614d044721eaa4b8'><b><span
