<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><a
name=introduction-2></a><a name="_Toc202716550"><span style='mso-bookmark:introduction-2'><span
lang=EN-AU>Introduction</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:introduction-2'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span
style='mso-bookmark:introduction-2'><span lang=EN-AU>Whilst preparing version
5.0 of the Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS), it became clear
that there were a number of existing and newly suggested items that shouldn’t
be included as requirements in 5.0. This may have been because they were not in
scope for ASVS as per the definition for 5.0 or alternatively it was felt that
while they were a good idea, they could not be made mandatory.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span
style='mso-bookmark:introduction-2'><span lang=EN-AU>Not wanting to lose all
these items entirely, some have been captured in this appendix.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:introduction-2'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><a
name=recommended-in-scope-mechanisms></a><a name="_Toc202716551"><span
style='mso-bookmark:recommended-in-scope-mechanisms'><span lang=EN-AU>Recommended,
in-scope mechanisms</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:recommended-in-scope-mechanisms'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span
style='mso-bookmark:recommended-in-scope-mechanisms'><span lang=EN-AU>The
following items are in-scope for ASVS. They should not be made mandatory but it
is strongly recommended to consider them as part of a secure application.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo90'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:recommended-in-scope-mechanisms'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>A password strength meter
should provided to help users set a stronger password.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo90'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:recommended-in-scope-mechanisms'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Create a publicly available
security.txt file at the root or .well-known directory of the application that
clearly defines a link or e-mail address for people to contact owners about
security issues.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo90'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:recommended-in-scope-mechanisms'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Client-side input validation
should be enforced in addition to validation at a trusted service layer as this
provides a good opportunity to discover when someone has bypassed client-side
controls in an attempt to attack the application.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo90'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:recommended-in-scope-mechanisms'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Prevent accidentally accessible
and sensitive pages from appearing in search engines using a robots.txt file,
the X-Robots-Tag response header or a robots html meta tag.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo90'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:recommended-in-scope-mechanisms'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;

style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>When using GraphQL, implement
authorization logic at the business logic layer instead of the GraphQL or
resolver layer to avoid having to handle authorization on every separate
interface.</span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><a

style='mso-bookmark:software-security-principles'><span lang=EN-AU>Software
Security principles</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-principles'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span
style='mso-bookmark:software-security-principles'><span lang=EN-AU>The
following items were previously in ASVS but are not really requirements. Rather
they are principles to consider when implementing security controls that when
followed will lead to more robust controls. These include:</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo92'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-principles'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Security controls should be
centralized, simple (economy of design), verifiably secure, and reusable. This
should avoid duplicate, missing, or ineffective controls.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo92'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-principles'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Wherever possible, use
previously written and well-vetted security control implementations rather than
relying on implementing controls from scratch.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo92'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-principles'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Ideally, a single access
control mechanism should be used to access protected data and resources. All
requests should pass through this single mechanism to avoid copy and paste or
insecure alternative paths.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo92'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-principles'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Attribute or feature-based
access control is a recommended pattern whereby the code checks the user’s
authorization for a feature or data item rather than just their role.
Permissions should still be allocated using roles.</span></span></span></p>

<span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-principles'></span>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><a
name=software-security-processes></a><a name="_Toc202716553"><span
style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><span lang=EN-AU>Software
Security processes</span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span
style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><span lang=EN-AU>There are a
number of security processes which were removed from ASVS 5.0 but are still a
good idea. The OWASP SAMM project may be a good source for how to effectively
implement these processes. The items which were previously in ASVS include:</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo93'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Verify the use of a secure
software development lifecycle that addresses security in all stages of
development.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo93'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Verify the use of threat
modeling for every design change or sprint planning to identify threats, plan
for countermeasures, facilitate appropriate risk responses, and guide security
testing.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo93'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that all user stories
and features contain functional security constraints, such as “As a user, I
should be able to view and edit my profile. I should not be able to view or
edit anyone else’s profile”</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo93'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Verify availability of a secure
coding checklist, security requirements, guideline, or policy to all developers
and testers.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo93'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that an ongoing process
exists to ensure that the application source code is free from backdoors,
malicious code (e.g., salami attacks, logic bombs, time bombs), and
undocumented or hidden features (e.g., Easter eggs, insecure debugging tools).
Complying with this section is not possible without complete access to source
code, including third-party libraries, and is therefore probably only suitable
for applications requiring the very highest levels of security.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo93'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that mechanisms are in
place to detect and respond to configuration drift in deployed environments.
This may include using immutable infrastructure, automated redeployment from a
secure baseline, or drift detection tools that compare current state against
approved configurations.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt;text-indent:-24.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo93'><span
style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-AU style='mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>•<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-AU>Verify that configuration
hardening is performed on all third-party products, libraries, frameworks, and
services as per their individual recommendations.</span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:appendix-d-recommendations'><span
style='mso-bookmark:software-security-processes'><span lang=EN-AU>References:</span></span></span></p>
